Powers of Secretary of State
	For the avoidance of doubt, nothing in sections 31 to 33 of the 1996 Actprevents the powers of the Secretary of State under section 6 of the RailwaysAct [2005 (c. 14)](/id/ukpga/2005/14?view=plain "Go to item of legislation")from being exercised in relation to the rail link or railway services on it.
	In subsection (1) “rail link” has the same meaning as in the 1996 Act.
Access contracts
	In section 17 of the 1996 Act (access agreements), the following are repealed—
		in subsection (2), the words “Subject to subsection (3) below,”;
		subsection (3).
Duties of Office of Rail Regulation
	In section 21 of the 1996 Act (duties of the Office of Rail Regulation as tothe exercise of regulatory functions), the following are repealed—
		subsections (2) to (5);
		in subsection (6), the definitions of “existing”, “international services”and “network”;
		in subsection (7), the words “or (2)”.
Power of Office of Rail Regulation to charge fees
	After section 21 of the 1996 Act insert—
	“21AFees
		Subject to this section, the Office of Rail Regulation may by noticerequire a rail link undertaker to pay a fee in respect of the exercise of anyof the Office of Rail Regulation’s functions in relation to the rail link.
		The amount of a fee under subsection (1) in any case shall be—
			such amount as is reasonably incurred by the Office of Rail Regulation inthe exercise of the function in relation to the rail link, or
			in a case where there is more than one rail link undertaker, suchproportion of the amount referred to in paragraph (a) as the Office of RailRegulation considers it reasonable for the rail link undertaker to pay.
		Subsection (1) does not apply to the functions assigned to the Office ofRail Regulation by virtue of section 67(2) and (3) of the Railways Act 1993.
		A notice under this section must specify—
			the amount of the fee to be paid, and
			the date by which it is to be paid.
		Any amount payable under a notice under this section which remains unpaidafter the date specified in the notice may be recovered by the Office of RailRegulation as a civil debt due to it.
		The Office of Rail Regulation may revise a notice under this section by afurther such notice.
		The Office of Rail Regulation may refund any amount which, further to anyrevised notice under subsection (6), appears to have been overpaid to it.”
Meaning of “development agreement”
	In section 56 of the 1996 Act (interpretation) in the definition of“development agreement” in subsection (1), for “or maintenance” substitute “,maintenance or operation”.
Interpretation, commencement, short title
	In this Act, “the 1996 Act” means the Channel Tunnel Rail Link Act [1996(c. 61)](/id/ukpga/1996/61?view=plain "Go to item of legislation").
	This Act comes into force at the end of the period of two months beginningwith the day on which it is passed.
	This Act may be cited as the Channel Tunnel Rail Link (SupplementaryProvisions) Act 2008.
